fields.name: Brier Score
fields.description: Computes the Brier's score, defined as the average (over test examples) of sumx(t(x)-p(x))^2, where x is a class, t(x) is 1 for the correct class and 0 for the others, and p(x) is the probability that the classifier assigned to the class x.

fields.name: Classification Accuracy
fields.description: Computes classification accuracy, i.e. percentage of matches between predicted and actual class. The function returns a list of classification accuracies of all classifiers tested. If reportSE is set to true, the list will contain tuples with accuracies and standard errors.

fields.name: Cutoff
fields.description: We can also add the keyword argument cutoff (e.g. confusionMatrices(results, cutoff=0.3); if we do, confusionMatrices will disregard the classifiers' class predictions and observe the predicted probabilities, and consider the prediction "positive" if the predicted probability of the positive class is higher than the cutoff.

fields.name: Confusion Matrix Computations
fields.description: With the confusion matrix defined in terms of positive and negative classes, you can also compute the sensitivity [TP/(TP+FN)], specificity [TN/(TN+FP)], positive predictive value [TP/(TP+FP)] and negative predictive value [TN/(TN+FN)]. In information retrieval, positive predictive value is called precision (the ratio of the number of relevant records retrieved to the total number of irrelevant and relevant records retrieved), and sensitivity is called recall (the ratio of the number of relevant records retrieved to the total number of relevant records in the database). The harmonic mean of precision and recall is called an F-measure, where, depending on the ratio of the weight between precision and recall is implemented as F1 [2*precision*recall/(precision+recall)] or, for a general case, Falpha [(1+alpha)*precision*recall / (alpha*precision + recall)].

fields.name: Correct Class Average Probability
fields.description: Computes the average probability assigned to the correct class.

fields.name: Information Score
fields.description: Computes the information score as defined by Kononenko and Bratko (1991).

fields.name: Leave One Out
fields.description: Performs a leave-one-out experiment with the given list of learners and examples. This is equivalent to performing len(examples)-fold cross validation. Function accepts additional keyword arguments for preprocessing, storing classifiers and verbose output.

fields.name: Proportion Test
fields.description: Splits the data with a number of examples in the learning and the rest in the testing set. The test is repeated for a given number of times (default 10). Division is stratified by default. Function also accepts keyword arguments for randomization and storing classifiers.

fields.name: Add Class Noise
fields.description: Adds class noise to a specified percentage of data instances.

fields.name: Table
fields.description: Altered table

fields.name: Load Dataset to Orange Data Table
Orange Data Table to ARFF String
fields.description: Transforms an orange data table to an arff string.

fields.name: Orange Data Table to ARFF file
Orange Data Table to CSV file
Orange Data Table to TAB file
Data table
fields.description: Data table in form of a .tab file.

fields.name: Data table
fields.description: Modified data table, with designated Class Attribute.

fields.name: Select Data
fields.description: Select data according to the filter provided by user

fields.name: data
fields.description: Data to be filtered.

fields.name: Matching Data
fields.description: Data matching the filter provided

fields.name: Split dataset
fields.description: Splits a dataset to a train and test dataset.

fields.name: Dataset
fields.description: A dataset that will be split into two parts

fields.name: Split factor
fields.description: A number between 0 and 1 that determines the sizes of the two datasets

fields.name: Train data
fields.description: Train data

fields.name: Test data
fields.description: Test data

fields.name: UCI Dataset to Orange Data Table
Filter ReliefF
fields.description: Takes the data set data and a measure for score of attributes measure. Repeats the process of estimating attributes and removing the worst attribute if its measure is lower than margin. Stops when no attribute score is below this margin. The default for measure is relief(k=20, m=50), and margin defaults to 0.0

fields.name: Select Attributes Above Threshold
fields.description: Constructs and returns a new data set that includes a class and attributes from the list returned by function attMeasure that have the score above or equal to a specified threshold. data is used to pass an original data set. Parameter threshold is optional and defaults to 0.0.

fields.name: Select best N attributes
fields.description: Constructs and returns a new data set that includes a class and only N best attributes from a list scores. data is used to pass an original data set.
